headline.main: Two Studies Link Easy-to-Cure Infection to the Risk of Premature Birth

docs.lead_paragraph: A common, easy-to-cure female infection is responsible for about 6 percent of premature births, making it a major underlying cause of infant mortality, researchers say. The condition, called bacterial vaginosis, affects up to one-quarter of pregnant women and can be eliminated with standard antibiotics. But most women who are infected do not know they are.
